verses.verse: The burden<WH4853> of the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> in the land<WH776> of Hadrach,<WH2317> and Damascus<WH1834> shall be the rest<WH4496> thereof: when<WH3588> the eyes<WH5869> of man,<WH120> as of all<WH3605> the tribes<WH7626> of Israel,<WH3478> shall be toward the LORD.<WH3068>
And Hamath<WH2574> also<WH1571> shall border<WH1379> thereby; Tyrus,<WH6865> and Zidon,<WH6721> though<WH3588> it be very<WH3966> wise.<WH2449>
And Tyrus<WH6865> did build<WH1129> herself a strong<WH4692> hold,<WH4692> and heaped<WH6651> up silver<WH3701> as the dust,<WH6083> and fine gold<WH2742> as the mire<WH2916> of the streets.<WH2351>
Behold,<WH2009> the LORD<WH136> will cast<WH3423> her out, and he will smite<WH5221> her power<WH2428> in the sea;<WH3220> and she shall be devoured<WH398> with fire.<WH784>

Ashkelon<WH831> shall see<WH7200> it, and fear;<WH3372> Gaza<WH5804> also shall see it, and be very<WH3966> sorrowful,<WH2342> and Ekron;<WH6138> for her expectation<WH4007> shall be ashamed;<WH954> and the king<WH4428> shall perish<WH6> from Gaza,<WH5804> and Ashkelon<WH831> shall not be inhabited.<WH3427>
And a bastard<WH4464> shall dwell<WH3427> in Ashdod,<WH795> and I will cut<WH3772> off the pride<WH1347> of the Philistines.<WH6430>

And I will take<WH5493> away<WH5493> his blood<WH1818> out of his mouth,<WH6310> and his abominations<WH8251> from between<WH996> his teeth:<WH8127> but he that remains,<WH7604> even<WH1571> he, shall be for our God,<WH430> and he shall be as a governor<WH441> in Judah,<WH3063> and Ekron<WH6138> as a Jebusite.<WH2983>

And I will encamp<WH2583> about my house<WH1004> because of the army,<WH4675> because of him that passes<WH5674> by, and because of him that returns:<WH7725> and no<WH3808> oppressor<WH5065> shall pass<WH5674> through them any more:<WH5750> for now<WH6258> have I seen<WH7200> with my eyes.<WH5869>

Rejoice<WH1523> greatly,<WH3966> O daughter<WH1323> of Zion;<WH6726> shout,<WH7321> O daughter<WH1323> of Jerusalem:<WH3389> behold,<WH2009> your King<WH4428> comes<WH935> to you: he is just,<WH6662> and having salvation;<WH3467> lowly,<WH6041> and riding<WH7392> on an ass,<WH2543> and on a colt<WH5895> the foal<WH1121> of an ass.<WH860>

And I will cut<WH3772> off the chariot<WH7393> from Ephraim,<WH669> and the horse<WH5483> from Jerusalem,<WH3389> and the battle<WH4421> bow<WH7198> shall be cut<WH3772> off: and he shall speak<WH1696> peace<WH7965> to the heathen:<WH1471> and his dominion<WH4915> shall be from sea<WH3220> even to sea,<WH3220> and from the river<WH5104> even to the ends<WH657> of the earth.<WH776>
As for you also,<WH1571> by the blood<WH1818> of your covenant<WH1285> I have sent<WH7971> forth your prisoners<WH615> out of the pit<WH953> wherein is no<WH3808> water.<WH4325>
Turn<WH7725> you to the strong<WH1225> hold,<WH1225> you prisoners<WH615> of hope:<WH8615> even<WH1571> to day<WH3117> do I declare<WH5046> that I will render<WH7725> double<WH4932> to you;

When<WH3588> I have bent<WH1869> Judah<WH3063> for me, filled<WH4390> the bow<WH7198> with Ephraim,<WH669> and raised<WH5782> up your sons,<WH1121> O Zion,<WH6726> against<WH5921> your sons,<WH1121> O Greece,<WH3120> and made<WH7760> you as the sword<WH2719> of a mighty<WH1368> man.

And the LORD<WH3068> shall be seen<WH7200> over<WH5921> them, and his arrow<WH2671> shall go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> as the lightning:<WH1300> and the LORD<WH136> God<WH3069> shall blow<WH8628> the trumpet,<WH7782> and shall go<WH1980> with whirlwinds<WH5591> of the south.<WH8486>

The LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> shall defend<WH1598> them; and they shall devour,<WH398> and subdue<WH3533> with sling<WH7050> stones;<WH68> and they shall drink,<WH8354> and make a noise<WH6963> as through wine;<WH3196> and they shall be filled<WH4390> like bowls,<WH4219> and as the corners<WH2106> of the altar.<WH4196>

And the LORD<WH3068> their God<WH430> shall save<WH3467> them in that day<WH3117> as the flock<WH6629> of his people:<WH5971> for they shall be as the stones<WH68> of a crown,<WH5145> lifted<WH5264> up as an ensign<WH5264> on his land.<WH127>

For how<WH4100> great is his goodness,<WH2898> and how<WH4100> great is his beauty!<WH3308> corn<WH1715> shall make the young<WH970> men cheerful,<WH5107> and new<WH8492> wine<WH8492> the maids.<WH1330>
